title: Streamlines Excel File Automation
text: goal excelsior provide tools automating data entry involves transferring data one excel file another.

title: Streamlines Excel File Automation
text: can install development version excelsior GitHub : Rtools installed, can install package (xldiff, upon depends) FRAMverse R universe:

what: Convert character vector to numeric with intelligent handling — as_numeric_smart
title: Convert character vector to numeric with intelligent handling — as_numeric_smart
text: Converts character vector numeric intelligently handling common formatting appears reading mixed numeric character cells excel, like commas percentages.

title: Convert character vector to numeric with intelligent handling — as_numeric_smart
Convert character vector to numeric with intelligent handling — as_numeric_smart
text: vec vector convert numeric

title: Convert character vector to numeric with intelligent handling — as_numeric_smart
text: numeric vector following transformations applied: Commas removed (e.g., "1,000" becomes 1000) Percentages removed numbers converted proportions (e.g., "10%" becomes 0.1) Values converted return NA

title: Convert character vector to numeric with intelligent handling — as_numeric_smart

what: Translate copied excel row/column into code to make an R vector — clip_to_vec
title: Translate copied excel row/column into code to make an R vector — clip_to_vec
text: Function interacts computer clipboard. use, start copying row column excel want coded vector R. Run clip_to_vec() change system clipboard string R code defines equivalent vector, paste R script.

title: Translate copied excel row/column into code to make an R vector — clip_to_vec
Translate copied excel row/column into code to make an R vector — clip_to_vec
text: Nothing

what: Copy columns from one Excel file to another with change tracking — copy_columns
title: Copy columns from one Excel file to another with change tracking — copy_columns
text: Copies specified columns input Excel file workbook, highlighting changes compared master file adding metadata transfer. row_start row_end easily identified using row_finder().

title: Copy columns from one Excel file to another with change tracking — copy_columns
code: copy_columns(   wb,   to_file,   from_file,   sheet,   columns,   row_start,   row_end,   color_scheme,   meta_cell,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Copy columns from one Excel file to another with change tracking — copy_columns
text: wb openxlsx2 workbook object modify to_file Character. Filepath "original" reference file from_file Character. Filepath containing workbook data copy sheet Character. Sheet name copy /columns Character vector. Excel column letters copy (e.g., c("", "B")) row_start Integer. Initial row number copy row_end Integer. Final row number copy color_scheme Character vector length 2. Hex colors "Changed" "Unchanged" cells. Use general color different shades. meta_cell Character. Excel cell reference add transfer metadata (color, file, date). verbose Logical. Whether print progress messages. Defaults TRUE.

title: Copy columns from one Excel file to another with change tracking — copy_columns
text: Modified workbook object copied data, change highlighting, metadata

what: Copy data section between locations in Excel workbook — copy_section
title: Copy data section between locations in Excel workbook — copy_section
text: Designed updating mind. Copies data one location another within Excel workbook, optional validation checks matching reference rows/columns. safe version saying "Copy sheet C3:D4 sheet 1 E5:F6 sheet 2". support speed, function takes arguments openxlsx2 workbook object  updated, dataframe update .

title: Copy data section between locations in Excel workbook — copy_section
code: copy_section(   wb,   from_df,   from_address,   to_address,   sheet,   check_row_offset = NULL,   check_col_offset = NULL,   numeric_flag = TRUE,   debug_mode = FALSE )

title: Copy data section between locations in Excel workbook — copy_section
text: wb openxlsx2 workbook object from_df dataframe complete sheet contains data copy . Typically generated readxl::read_excel col_names = FALSE .name_repair = "unique_quiet. from_address Character string specifying source cell range (e.g., "A1:C3"). to_address Character string specifying destination cell range (e.g., "D1:F3") sheet Character string numeric index specifying target sheet check_row_offset Optional, integer offset identifying row used validate /sections match. Positive values correspond rows first row addresses specified. check_col_offset Optional, integer offset identifying column used validate /sections match. Positive values correspond columns first column addresses specified. numeric_flag Logical indicating whether data converted numeric (default: TRUE) debug_mode Logical indicating whether enable debug mode highlighting (default: FALSE)

title: Copy data section between locations in Excel workbook — copy_section
text: Modified workbook object data copied

title: Copy data section between locations in Excel workbook — copy_section
text: key feature function optional checking, first column row "from_db" checked corresponding column row "to_address" make sure entries still appropriate. example, updating TAMM template file new year's data, rectangular section locations values present TAMM input template; want update input template new TAMM values. can code cell addresses, identifying want copy cells "D126:F130" TAMM "D5:F9" current sheet input template. However, encounter problems users re-arranged either excel sheet. reason, want confirm location column (1 column left leftmost cells copying) matches. provide "check_col_offset = 1" argument. causes function check "C123:C130" TAMM matches "C5:C9" current sheet input template.

what: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
title: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
text: objects imported packages. Follow links see documentation. xldiff cell_range_translate

what: Find row number based on an
title: Find row number based on an
text: Excel sheets sometimes updated add additional rows. function find rows interest based "anchor cells" – cells known contents (e.g., column headers) known column. Using instead hard-coding row numbers can make automation less fragile addition rows.

title: Find row number based on an
code: row_finder(filepath, sheet, column, pattern, instance = 1, offset = 0)

title: Find row number based on an
text: filepath Character. Filepath Excel file interest sheet Character numeric. Sheet name index search column Character numeric. Column contains anchor cell number (e.g., 3) corresponding excel column label ("C"). pattern Character. Pattern identify anchor cell. Accepts regular expressions – see details. instance Numeric. match use multiple matches found? Defaults 1. offset Numeric. Number add returned row number. Useful pattern identifies title row want row (1) (-1). Defaults 0

title: Find row number based on an
text: Numeric. Row number pattern found, adjusted offset

title: Find row number based on an
text: pattern argument accepts regular expressions, flexible just exactly matching string. tips: R treats \ specially – present pattern, surround square brackets treat actual characters. regular expressions, ^ symbol used denote start string, $ symbol used denote end string. example practice, anchor cell footnote "/  Derived vessel registrations fish landing tickets.", use pattern section text (e.g., pattern = "Derived vessel registrations fish"). wanted ensure first occurrence "/..." used anchor (case footnote text changes), use pattern "^[/]", words means "first letter , second letter literally /".

title: Find row number based on an
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ row_finder("data.xlsx", "Sheet1", "A", "Total", instance = 1, offset = 1) row_finder("data.xlsx", 1, 3, "Summary", offset = -1) } # }

what: Find anchor cell based on fill color — row_finder_by_color
title: Find anchor cell based on fill color — row_finder_by_color
text: Useful handling sheets use color-filled rows separators (e.g., STT table files).

title: Find anchor cell based on fill color — row_finder_by_color
code: row_finder_by_color(   filepath,   sheet,   column = 1,   color = "FF000000",   instance = 1,   offset = 0 )

title: Find anchor cell based on fill color — row_finder_by_color
text: filepath Character. Filepath Excel file interest sheet Character numeric. Sheet name index search column Character numeric. Column contains anchor cell number (e.g., 3) corresponding excel column label ("C"). color Character vector. Color anchor cell hex, without preliminary "#". Defaults black ("FF000000"). instance Numeric. match use multiple matches found? Defaults 1. offset Numeric. Number add returned row number. Useful pattern identifies title row want row (1) (-1). Defaults 0

title: Find anchor cell based on fill color — row_finder_by_color
text: Row number (numeric length 1)

title: Find anchor cell based on fill color — row_finder_by_color
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## find the row before the first column has a cell with black fill row_finder_by_color("Appendix D.xlsx", sheet = "D-3", column = 1, offset = -1) } # }

title: excelsior 0.0.1
text: row_finder_by_color(): finds row based anchor cell, using known column fill color find_fill_color(): finds fill color specified cell excel sheet, help use row_finder_by_color() row_finder(): finds row number based “anchor” cell known column pattern. as_numeric_smart(): .numeric(), correctly handles cases numbers commas , numbers ending %s. copy_columns(): copies specified sets columns start_row end_row one file another, highlighting cells copied cells changed values implant_df() copy_section() copy sections excel sheets addition clip_to_vec() make coding easier addition validate_*() input validation TODO: - confirm fram r-universe including
